item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, January 27, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We're bringing Pebble back (814 points | 210 comments)
2. Google open-sources the Pebble OS (458 points | 91 comments)
3. The Taylorator – All Your Frequencies Are Belong to Us (193 points | 55 comments)
4. Using AI for Coding: My Journey with Cline and Large Language Models (59 points | 11 comments)
5. DeepSeek releases Janus Pro, a text-to-image generator [pdf] (512 points | 374 comments)
6. The ocean teems with networks of interconnected bacteria (60 points | 10 comments)
7. I trusted an LLM, now I'm on day 4 of an afternoon project (96 points | 59 comments)
8. My failed attempt to shrink all NPM packages by 5% (273 points | 179 comments)
9. The Alpha Myth: How captive wolves led us astray (105 points | 72 comments)
10. Facebook ban on discussing Linux? (326 points | 129 comments)
11. Go 1.24's go tool is one of the best additions to the ecosystem in years (97 points | 29 comments)
12. Oliver Heaviside and the theory of transmission lines (2021) (214 points | 63 comments)
13. Show HN: I Made an iOS Podcast Player with Racket (162 points | 55 comments)
14. Operation Leg – a pilot unlike any other (2020) (158 points | 68 comments)
15. Bilinear down/upsampling, aligning pixel grids, and that infamous GPU half pixel (2021) (95 points | 14 comments)
16. The Curious Case of Quentell (64 points | 5 comments)
17. Dragonsweeper — A minesweeper game that requires observation (6 points | 1 comment)
18. A Faster Quantum Fourier Transform (27 points | 1 comment)
19. Show HN: I Created ErisForge, a Python Library for Abliteration of LLMs (87 points | 39 comments)
20. The future of Rebble (317 points | 17 comments)
21. Nvidia sheds almost $600B in market cap, biggest one-day loss in US history (173 points | 153 comments)
22. SiFive's P550 Microarchitecture (129 points | 44 comments)
23. Peanut Butter Day: Going Nuts over NIST's Standard Reference Peanut Butter (2016) (81 points | 48 comments)
24. A layoff fundamentally changed how I perceive work (842 points | 787 comments)
25. Non-random uniform disk sampling (38 points | 23 comments)
26. Using the Rust standard library with the NuttX RTOS (46 points | 14 comments)
27. Openhaystack: Build 'AirTags' – track Bluetooth devices via Apple's network (408 points | 101 comments)
28. The impact of competition and DeepSeek on Nvidia (560 points | 390 comments)
29. Lessons in creating family photos that people want to keep (2018) (355 points | 139 comments)
30. TBM 333: Lean Graph Theory (16 points | 4 comments)
